means: 使（国王、女王或主教）登基，即位

sentence.Network_cn: 他正迫使政府推崇一种现代主义。

sentence.Network_en: King of kings salvation brings Let loving hearts enthrone Him.
sentence.Network_cn: 万王之王赐下救赎,心灵当尊他为王.

list.abs: the Lord sits enthroned over the flood ; the Lord is enthroned as King forever .10洪水泛滥之时，耶和华坐着为王；耶和华坐着为王，直到永远。
[be enthroned] 帝王即位执政10. 登记dēngjì[register;check in] 载入正式记录在名单上登记11. 登科dēngkē[receive government degrees] 科举时代应考人被.
But you , O LORD , sit enthroned forever ; your renown endures through all generations ., 惟你耶和华必存到永远 . 你可记念的名 , 也存到万代.
and fifty years he shall remain in anguish and subjection , and then three hundred more he shall sit enthroned .一百五十年以来，他会仍然在痛苦和征服事，然后有三百多年时期，他会坐在王位。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent. (gradually replacing late Middle English enthronize; formerly also as inthrone): from en-, in- 'on' + throne

entry.tran: 使（国王、女王、皇帝、主教等）登位;使登基
entry.def: When kings, queens, emperors, or bishops are enthroned, they officially take on their role during a special ceremony.

example.ex: Emperor Akihito of Japan has been enthroned in Tokyo...
example.tran: 日本的明仁天皇已在东京登基。

example.ex: He is expected to be enthroned early next year as the spiritual leader of the Church of England.
example.tran: 预计他将于明年年初登位，成为英国国教的精神领袖。

entry.def: If an idea is enthroned, it has an important place in people's life or thoughts.

example.ex: He was forcing the State to enthrone a particular brand of modernism.
example.tran: 他正迫使政府推崇一种现代主义。

example.ex: ...the religious fundamentalism now enthroned in American life.
example.tran: 如今在美国人生活中备受尊崇的宗教原教旨主义

sentences.sentence: "They vested the council with special rights"

means.word_mean: 2. put a monarch on the throne;

sentences.sentence: "The Queen was enthroned more than 50 years ago"

auth_sentence.content: If she seem an angel to you, enthrone her in your heart of hearts.
